entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from dan damage, from Latin damnum

def.dt: :loss or harm resulting from injury to person, property, or reputation
:compensation in money imposed by law for loss or injury
:expense cost “What's the damage?” he asked the waiter
:to cause damage to don't damage the furniture returning soldiers damaged by war
:measures taken to offset or minimize damage to reputation, credibility, or public image caused by a controversial act, remark, or revelation
:injury inflicted on something other than an intended target
:insurance protecting against all or part of an individual's legal liability for damage done (as by his or her automobile) to the property of another
